message:
لو نفس ال algorithm اتكتب بلغات مختلفة... ايه اللغة اللي هتحتاج سيرفرات ارخص وتكون خفيفة وسريعة لنفس عدد اليوزرز؟
.Net
php
Python
Ruby

ولا حاجة تانية؟

باختصار.. هنعمل iOS app with a web service 
بس عايزين نقلل تكلفة السيرفرات لان فلوسنا بتخلص

سمعت من ناس كتير ان Python اسرع... ويمكن ده اللي خلى جوجل وفيس بوك يعتمدوا عليها... 
المهم... بفرض اننا هنعتمد عليها... لو Net Freelancer. هياخد مني ٣ الاف جنيه عشان يعملي ال web service دي... يبقى ال Python freelancer ممكن ياخد كام؟

وده شخص موجود في مصر ولا نشوف من برة؟ ولا ايه اللي مناسب وموجود في مصر؟

Update: The app is a matching app similar to Tinder.

data.message: في ناس بتعرف بايثون كويس بس قليلين.. اعتقد انه حسب حجم الشغلانة.. 3000 ممكن يبقوا كويس لو حاجة تاخد كام يوم
Javascript (Node.js)
Most of Google services are in either C++ or Java, and most recently they've been pushing more Go
I Recommended NodeJs Or PHP

We r building our backend www.zingo-app.com with node. The full stack is Mongo/Express/Node, I strongly recommend it, fast+almost all developers are somewhat familiar with JS.
Wishing u the best of luck.
https://parse.com/

For performance always go for a native language, managed languages such as java and .net have very bad performance, interpreted languages such as php and python are even worst.. for cost of development go for languages that have a good ecosystem such as .net languages, Microsoft have built a huge ecosystem in the Egyptian market, but be aware that unlike open source languages most of the software you will need is not for free.. it's a hard decision :-)

Anyway if you are low in cash, always go after open source technologies.. that is a given.. for performance critical applications use C++ or even C but it will depend more on the developer rather than the technology to tune the application really good!
Security should be highly considered :)

I would suggest Parse.com for a backend. Very versatile and easy to use and provides SDKs for a variety of client types. They provide storage, user registration, custom objects.. etc. Also, it is free to use unless you are making 30+ requests per second.

It all boils down to what you're trying to do, and your resource consumption patterns. For example, Ruby has a rich library, but its loops are slow. They make it up by using C (or Java for JRuby) to implement most important functions. Python can be a memory hog if the developer is novice or just not careful enough. C++ can be fast, but you'd probably use a bridge to expose it over an API. Java can be even faster in some cases due to dynamic optimization, but it usually allocates a lot of memory to minimize the overhead of the GC. Go compiles to native code AFAIK, but it's knowledge is very rare, and so are its libraries. JavaScript and PHP have optimized VMs (e.g V8 and HHVM), but due to their dynamic nature I doubt they can do much to an algorithm that could make use of CPU vector operations. Vector based languages such as R and MATLAB are best for number crunching.

So what is it that you're trying to do? :-)
I'd stay away from .NET if I were you. There is no point in paying for a license for Windows if you're building a backend tool.
https://golang.org/

I agree with Hosam Aly comment above. If you can give us more details about what you're trying to do, the expected number of transactions per second, etc, this will help us give you a realistic advice.

GO
NODE
Python is faster than PHP and consume less CPU, but it depends on how many requests do you process per second, and you can start with shared hosting until you need VPS.

YOU ALL WRONG 
Algorithm performance measured differently, Time complexity measure by some technique called (Big Oh Notation).
Read about it and you will know that all of you are WRONG
^ Duh

I would say go with whatever technology you know you can get it done with and released faster!
